intro: Palicourea hyacinthiflora, commonly known as the hyacinth-flowered palicourea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its attractive, hyacinth-like flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often glandular and aromatic. Palicourea hyacinthiflora is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its beauty and fragrance.
